name: Durker Roods Hotel

reviews.title: Oh dear...
reviews.text: Booked a table for 6, Christmas Dinner. Paid the deposit back in November. Turned up to be told they had us booked for the carvery! The deposit paid was more than the cost of the carvery and we had a confirmation note stating a booking for Christmas dinner. It didn't need inspector Morse to work out they'd cocked-up. Jacob advised there wasn't enough food to offer us the Christmas menu! This is a hotel and we were 6 people. Was it really such a challenge to feed us. We stood our ground and eventually they offered a solution. Great, but next they seat us not in the main restaurant but in what I'd describe as the school dinner wing. Another quiet word with the staff and they move us to the main restaurant. Two complimentary bottles of wine are provided and the meal is offered at £10 per head. A good gesture I feel and in fairness from this point forward the service and food is good. If they had reacted this way at the point the problem first arose my review would have been better. As for the hotel, I can't comment on the rooms but the downstairs areas look a bit shabby and in need of refurbishment. Their website sells an image that the hotel can't deliver.

reviews.title: Birthday party
reviews.text: Recently attended my friends surprise birthday party and they did her proud. We had the Sunday lunch carvery and the food was tasty and freshly cooked.The service and ambience was excellent would call again when in the area.

we recently had a surprise 60th birthday family and friends meal for my mum at this hotel, we had a party of 20 and not one person left unhappy. the food and service was top class, nothing was too much trouble. the staff were very helpful and friendly and the food was excellent.
reviews.title: fab 60th birthday celebration

reviews.text: I will definitely be back and recommend to other people.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel food and service
could have been better
reviews.text: I can't praise this family run hotel enough me and my family have been numerous times for meals it's great value for money food is locally sorced and totally amazing nothing is too much for this friendly crew. Only wish I could go much more often but as I live in the north of Scotland ( Lossiemouth ) it's not possible. Keep doing what you do and I see you all again soon. Thank you for always making our visits special. Kerry
We had our wedding at Durker Roods on 1st September, and had an absolutely lovely day.
reviews.title: Wedding 1st September 2012

reviews.text: The staff at Durker Roods were very helpful and very flexible. Mayumi tailored the rooms exactly to the specification I suggested (including tieing 60 chair bows on the morning of the wedding)!
reviews.title: Faded Grandeur

reviews.text: The 4 course wedding breakfast was lovely, and evening buffet just as good. All of our guests enjoyed the day, and it was only made better by the amazing weather that we had too...which meant that we could enjoy the lovely surroundings that the hotel had too.
reviews.title: great location and large, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our guests have all passed on their compliments to me about how nice the hotel was, and what wonderful meal and drinks they had.
reviews.title: Sharon H

reviews.text: We had a great day!
reviews.title: faded glory or undeveloped potential

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights to attend a wedding which was being held there.
reviews.title: Lovely food, very friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception we got when we arrived was very good with staff offering to help with our bags. The room was homely and very clean. We had a meal in the bar which was excellent. The young man behind the bar was very attentive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding went off without a hitch and the staff were extremely helpful. The manager was very professional but also very friendly and approachable.
reviews.title: Bad night out

reviews.text: We would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Most welcoming and good value
Never EVER again!
reviews.text: Booked a one night stay dinner, bed and breakfast so we could see a show in Holmfirth. Hotel clean and staff were great - eager to help and very friendly. Food was lovely - both in the evening and at breakfast. Would definitely use again if in the area.
Hotel is located at the top of a housing estate, bit bizarre!
reviews.title: Great old house - retaining some period features.

reviews.text: Set in its own grounds, beautiful period property!
reviews.title: a night with good friends
Next time I'm in the area will look for somewhere else
reviews.text: Very welcoming on arrival at reception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice lunch, served promptly in comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: A great relaxing break

reviews.text: Our room, no 1, was a Twin room very spacious, lovely high ceilings, big windows which actually opened!
reviews.title: no tabs

description: The family owned Durker Roods Hotel,is an impressive late Victorian house,retaining many of the original features. The house was formerly the home of Sir David Brown of Tractor and Aston Martin fame,and still boosts a lovely garden area and nature woodland.We are a friendly yet professional team and welcome visitors for weddings,conferences,short breaks,family gatherings and anniversaries.David Brown bar and lounge serves local"Real Ales" and great quality food which is also available in our elegant restaurant.We look forward to welcoming you to the Durker Roods Hotel.
